main event: On February 18, 1967, a circular object was observed in Condon, Oregon, that changed colors from white to red to blue and disappeared during the reporting process.
interesting points: The object changed colors while in view., The sighting occurred in high winds, which made it difficult to obtain clear observations., The object was reported to Gordon Air Forces Base., There were two witnesses who confirmed the sighting., The reporting individual indicated that the object was about 2 to 3 miles away and estimated its speed at 75 to 90 MPH.
witness description: Gordon, a 19-year-old male, and another individual named Carvin D. Standley.
